definitions.definition: based on reason rather than emotions

examples.text: There is no rational explanation for his actions.
It all seemed quite rational to me.
In some ways their behaviour is perfectly rational.
She seems incapable of making a rational decision.
We need to present them with a rational argument.

definitions.definition: able to think clearly and make decisions based on reason rather than emotions

examples.text: No rational person would ever behave like that.
Try to be rational about it.
She said that she had not been fully rational when she signed the form.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘having the ability to reason’): from Latin rationalis, from ratio(n-) ‘reckoning, reason’, from rat- ‘reckoned’, from the verb reri.
